section.title: Existing Records
section.para: For various reasons throughout the life of an International Trade transaction, the bank handling the transaction (as the Issuing Bank of an LC, SI, LI, RI, SG, TF or FT transaction, the Recipient or Issuing Bank for a BG, the Advising Bank for an EL, SR, the Remitting Bank for an EC or IR or the Presenting Bank for an IC) may need to send various transactional messages to its customers. Existing Records

A typical use of this feature is for the bank to notify an exporter about an amendment to a Export Letter of Credit notified previously in his favour, or for example to forward an advice of discrepancies to the applicant of an Import Letter of Credit.

More generally, the bank can use the generation of reporting from an existing record each time it needs to send a message to the customer and when this event is not a reply to something initiated by the client (in which case it would be accessed through the Pending Records module).

section.title: Existing Records - List of Records
section.para:
This function allows a Bank user to create reporting messages (amendments, cancellations, settlements etc.) on existing records, that have been processed by users at the bank. Existing Records
List
List
Existing Records When this option is selected, a list is displayed of records that have been processed.

Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. These are the , Bank Ref, Company (that sent the request), or Product fields. (The product can be any of those that enable a client to send a request to the bank.) The list is not displayed until search criteria has been entered and the Search button has been clicked. To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.
The columns returned in the list of Existing Records are the following:

entry.para: Unique reference number generated by for this file, when it was initiated.
Reference that was assigned by your bank's back office to this transaction.
Abbreviated name of the company that sent the transaction.
Current status of the transaction. The possible values are the following:

listitem.para: New indicates the state of any product right after its successful initiation,
Amended is typically the state of a Letter of Credit or a Banker's Guarantee after an amendment has been applied,
Updated is the generic state generally given by the bank as a follow-up to a free format message transaction initiated by the customer.

Other statuses are available on the bank side and can be used by the Trade Services team when generating a reporting message. The following chapters will provide further details on these custom product status codes. Hence the state born by a transaction record could also be Accepted, Settled, Cancelled, Extended or Purged.

entry.para: Master amount of the transaction record (not necessarily the same as the current outstanding amount).

section.title: Existing Record Reporting Form - Transaction Details
section.para:
This section of the form summarises the key information of the transaction. For all products, it contains the following fields:
Field
Type
Description
Full Transaction Details
(
Icon at the right-hand end of the General Details title line.) Open a pop up window to show the full details of the current transaction. The content of this pop up window is specific to each product.
Company Name
Abbreviated name of the company that owns the transaction (whether as applicant, beneficiary, drawee or drawer).
Product Code
Type of product that the transaction relates to, either Import or Export Letter of Credit, Shipping Guarantee, Financing Request, Issued or Received Standby LC, Banker's Guarantee, Export or Import Documentary Collection, Fund Transfer or Inward Remittance.
Unique reference number generated by for this file, when it was initiated.
Transaction Id
Unique reference number generated by for this event associated with this transaction. This field is only displayed if the transaction has been actioned previously by the Bank
Bank Reference
Reference assigned by your bank's back office to this transaction. Usually referred to as the back-office reference.
Transaction Type
Aways shows Reporting. This type indicates a Bank-towards-Customer reporting message.

section.title: Existing Record Reporting Form - Reporting Message Details
section.para:
The second section provides input fields to enter the details specific to the new event currently being created:
Field
Type
Description
New Transaction Status
Specify here the new status of the transaction record as it should be after the current event. This new status is the key information shown to the customer user when browsing the bank reporting or the history of the transaction.
Be careful to choose an appropriate code in view of the previous status - the system does not validate that the status is appropriate .
The drop down list shows the possible values, which in the standard version of . Some of these are as follows (with sample interpretations):
Updated: a generic term to indicate that the record has been updated.
Amended : this status should be used only for acknowledgement or notification of Import or Export Commercial or Standby Letters of Credit and Banker's Guarantee amendments.
Extended: typically applicable to an extension of maturity date for a financing transaction.
Accepted: this could be used to notify the customer of an acceptance of bill.
Settled: to indicate any kind of principle settlement on any kind of product (for instance the full final settlement of Trust Receipt).
Partially Settled: same as above but reserved for partial settlements.
Cancelled: typically for the redemption and cancellation of a Shipping Guarantee.
Released: this status should typically be associated with a Banker's Guarantee whose release has been pronounced.
Advise of Bill Arrival - Discrepant: this status can be chosen by the bank on an Import LC when it notifies discrepancies detected on a set of documents presented.
Advise of Bill Arrival - Clean: this status can be chosen by the bank on an Import LC when it notifies clean bills on a set of documents presented.
Sight Payment: typically selected by the issuing bank of a Commercial or Standby LC when there is a presentation of documents with an underlying full sight payment, and if the presentation is clean or alternatively when the applicant has given his acceptance on discrepancies previously notified.
Partial Sight Payment: same as above for a partial payment.
Purged: this is a technical code which will have a real impact on the file since the user will not be able to further update this record. It should be applied by the bank when it has purged the transaction in its own back-office system.
Rejected: also a technical code that can be used by the bank user to notify any kind of rejected action not applied to the record's master details.
Subject
Enter the subject as a summary of the message to be sent
Documents Amount
(Only applicable for Commercial or Standby Letters of Credit, both on the Import/Issued and Export/Received sides, and Export Collections., whose status is Discrepant, Accepted, Full Sight Payment, Partial Sight Payment, Full Settlement or Partial Settlement)
Amount of the related presentation of documents or alternatively the payment itself.
The outstanding amount of the transaction is updated accordingly only when the selected status is Accepted, Full Sight Payment or Partial Sight Payment.
Maturity Date
(Only applicable for Commercial or Standby Letter of Credit, both on the Import/Issued and Export/Received sides, and Export Collections, whose status is Discrepant, Accepted, Full Sight Payment, Partial Sight Payment, Full Settlement or Partial Settlement. )
Maturity date of the payment related to the presentation in the case of the choices Discrepant and Accepted.
For the other choices, it means the actual date of payment / settlement.
This field must be a properly formatted date and is mandatory when selecting any one of those statuses except Discrepant, Full Settlement or Partial Settlement for which it is optional.
The system will also automatically insert this maturity date into the company's calendar when selecting a status equal to Accepted, Full Sight Payment or Partial Sight Payment.
Attach a Cover Letter
Tick here if a cover letter is required. This field is present only for Direct EC.
Comment
Any explanation or details you need to give to indicate the characteristics of the completion of the reporting. Maximum of 500 lines of 75 characters. For example, for an Accepted transaction, you could provide a generic message of acceptance followed by the list of charges and commissions collected under the transaction. For Cancelled, you could enter some text to explain the reason for the Cancellation.
Click the list
icon to the right of the field, to select from a list of common phrases.

section.title: Existing Record Reporting Form - File Upload Details
section.para:
Clicking the Add a File button in this section of the form, allows files to be uploaded an attached to this transaction (Max 5 files and 1 Mb each). It contains the following fields:
Field
Type
Description
Add a File
Optionally, a list of files from your local hard disk giving additional details pertaining to this notification. Click Add a file to display a pop up form to add a file.
By default, the maximum size allowed for a file attachment is 5Mb. This can be altered by the bank system administrator.
Title
Title for the uploaded file. Up to 255 characters. This will appear on the client user's front-end as a link to download the file.
File
Text field and Browse button, which you use to attach the file from your local hard disk.

section.title: Existing Record Reporting Form - Action Buttons
section.para: The operations that can be performed from this form are listed below. They appear at the top (and bottom) of each relevant web page. For each of them, a pop up window will appear to confirm the choice.

entry.para: Save the transaction details (including the status, possible back-office reference, comment, and all the optional modifications of the transaction details) as a draft. The message remains as a pending record without being sent to the client. No validation of the mandatory fields is performed at this stage.
Send the message to the client. Do this when all the requested (and mandatory) transaction details have been entered and the resulting record is ready for submission.

Depending submitting users jurisdiction profile (in particular, the amount they are authorised to validate without an additional signature), the amendment is either sent to the client or remains in the bank workspace as unsigned.
Leave the current page and return to the main menu.
Open a pop up window displaying the online help pages.

section.title: Existing Record Reporting Form - Edit/Hide Transaction Details
section.para: The remaining sections are displayed only when the Edit Transaction Details link at the bottom of the web page is clicked. They have the overall heading Reported Transaction Details. They contain fields specific to the type of product. Use these to alter any of the transaction details of the transaction.

Due to its impact on potentially the whole set of data constituting a record, this feature should be handled carefully. This feature is very useful (and even mandatory in some cases) if any data has changed during the processing of the file by the back-office, hence ensuring that the customer will electronically receive a fully updated view of the transaction file.
The section Product-Specific Forms later in this book describes this part of the form for each product, and gives a brief introduction to each product.

section.title: Existing Records - Retrieve Unsigned
section.para:
This option is used by an authorised bank user, to submit an advice or notification that a bank user has already started but been unable to submit due to insufficient authority. Existing Records
Retrieve Unsigned
Retrieve Unsigned
Existing Records
Retrieve
Unsigned Existing Records

When this option is selected, a list is displayed of messages that have been prepared and saved by users in the bank, but have not been successfully submitted to the clients because the user had insufficient privileges. Records that were simply saved with no attempt to submit them are not included.
Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.

Click on the
column of the required entry to open it in a non-editable mode, in order to review the data and perform the submission. If sufficient authorisations are allocated in the profile of the authorising user, multiple records can be submitted in a single operation directly from the list. Each record in the list has a check box which must be ticked to select it. A Submit button at the end of the page, submits all the selected records.

The result of the action is then returned, with a list of records that have now been successfully sent to the clients, together with a list of records that have again failed validation. The updated list of unsigned records is re-displayed.
